subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS overproduction causing oxidative damage, mitochondrial fragmentation, mitophagy dysregulation, and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production rate, oxidative damage to mtDNA, and membrane fatty acid unsaturation as determinants of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial ROS cause cumulative oxidative damage to macromolecules driving aging, with interventions targeting ROS to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced mtDNA damage and vicious cycle of ROS and mtDNA mutations driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as primary aging drivers and importance of mitochondrial antioxidant capacity in longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Supports mitochondrial ROS as primary cause of aging and oxidative damage accumulation correlating with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights endogenous mitochondrial ROS production causing mtDNA oxidative damage and links membrane fatty acid unsaturation to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits mitochondrial ROS production causes cumulative oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction, accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced oxidative damage and vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging, with antioxidant defense considerations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radicals causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction leading to aging and healthspan decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondria as ROS source and target, ROS-induced mtDNA damage, and role of mitochondrial antioxidants in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA deletions causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging via a threshold effect and heteroplasmy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations and deletions causing respiratory chain defects and ROS vicious cycle accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative damage accumulation, mtDNA mutations, and copy number decline to mitochondrial dysfunction and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation accumulation, oxidative stress, and mitochondrial quality control dysregulation causing sarcopenia and muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation, mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS damage, and vicious cycle accelerating skeletal muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Correlates low mtDNA substitution rates with longevity and reduced oxidative stress in long-lived bivalve species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS-induced DNA damage response activating senescence pathways and limitations of ROS as sole senescence cause.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction as both cause and consequence of senescence, with feedback loops promoting aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy-mediated mitochondrial quality control, mtDNA leakage triggering inflammation, and mitophagy as anti-aging intervention.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial decline to aging, immune dysfunction, inflammaging, and resilience to stressors including infections.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial signaling dysfunction, altered metabolite and ROS signaling, and mitochondrial dysfunction driving physiologic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial impairment in neurons causing aging, synaptic dysfunction, and neurodegeneration via altered dynamics and quality control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes ATP/ADP allosteric inhibition of cytochrome c oxidase regulates membrane potential and limits ROS production to prevent aging damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial membrane lipid peroxidation susceptibility, ETS complex organization, and ROS management influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial respiration control at ETS complexes affecting ROS production and lifespan via flux control redistribution.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ETS supercomplex organization integrity as key to efficient electron transport, reduced ROS, and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Regulation and ROS Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes CLK-1/MCLK1 mitochondrial enzyme regulating ubiquinone biosynthesis and mitochondrial function, modulating aging rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Epigenetic Regulation and Stem Cell Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial metabolites regulating nuclear epigenetics, mitochondrial quality control, and stem cell fate affecting aging.
